solution.text:
In the given data, there are a total of 7 sacks.
Of that number, 3 sacks have a weight greater than _{j}_kg - (Sack Numbers 1,4 and 6).

We know that
\(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)

Therefore the Probability of the Event, P(E), of the chosen sack having weight greater than _{j}_ kg : \(\frac{3}{7}\)

content.text:
You are given 7 unmarked sacks of rice and the following table. If you choose a sack at random, what is the probability that it weighs more than _{j}_ kg? (Enter the answer as a simplified fraction)
Sack NumberWeight (kg)
1_{{j+k}}_
2_{{j-k}}_
3_{{j-2*k}}_
4_{{j+(k*0.3)}}_
5_{{j-(k*1.2)}}_
6_{{j+(k*0.4)}}_
7_{j}_
